verses.roman:
ya etat saṁsmaren martyas
tubhyaṁ mad-anuśāsanam
kīrtayann ubhayoḥ sandhyor
na yuṣmad bhayam āpnuyāt

synonyms: yaḥ—who; etat—this; saṁsmaret—remembers; martyaḥ—a mortal; tubhyam—to you; mat—My; anuśāsanam—command; kīrtayan—chanting; ubhayoḥ—at both; sandhyoḥ—junctures of the day; na—not; yuṣmat—from you; bhayam—fear; āpnuyāt—obtains.
translation: If a mortal being attentively remembers My command to you—to leave Vṛndāvana and go to the ocean—and narrates this account at sunrise and sunset, he will never be afraid of you.
